bill_title: provide for the termination of the decedent's interest in the joint tenancy of a surviving spouse by an interested party under certain circumstances.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide for the termination of the decedent's interest in the joint tenancy of a surviving spouse by an interested party under certain circumstances. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 21-44 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If the spouse of a decedent fails to terminate a joint tenancy in real property, any interested party may, upon the death of the surviving spouse, terminate the joint tenancy by furnishing the register of deeds of the county where the property is located with an affidavit setting forth the following: (1) The names and dates of death of the deceased joint tenants; (2) The legal description of the real property held in joint tenancy; (3) That all joint tenants in the real property are deceased. The affidavit shall be accompanied by a certified copy of the death certificates of the deceased joint tenants. The affidavit may be filed in lieu of the report required by § 10-41-17. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
